content:
• Wednesday, August 8, 2012
  • PHMD

    PhotoMedex (NASDAQ:PHMD) gains in the post session after reporting Q2 earnings of $0.58 per...

    PhotoMedex (NASDAQ:PHMD) gains in the post session after reporting Q2 earnings of $0.58 per share, beating the Street consensus of $0.30. Revenues came in at $59M, up 74% Y/Y, and also better than the Street's $54M estimate. Gross margin was 79.0% compared with 77.7% in the prior year, largely due to strength in its physician recurring and professional equipment segments. Shares +6.7% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 7:12 PM
  • RST

    More on Rosetta Stone (NYSE:RST): Q2 misses across the board. Total revenue decreased 9%,...

    More on Rosetta Stone (NYSE:RST): Q2 misses across the board. Total revenue decreased 9%, largely due to the rationalization of less efficient kiosks, lower sales internationally and a decline in the Institutional business because of the non-renewal of the Army and Marines contracts last year. Shares -2.6% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:51 PM
  • CHTR

    Charter Communications (NASDAQ:CHTR) says that selling stockholders, along with funds affiliated...

    Charter Communications (NASDAQ:CHTR) says that selling stockholders, along with funds affiliated with Apollo and Oaktree have agreed to sell approximately 5M shares of Charter common stock in a secondary offering. Charter will not sell any shares in the deal and will not receive any proceeds from the sale. Shares -3.3% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:38 PM

    C&J Energy Services (CJES): Q2 EPS of $0.99 beats by $0.07. Revenue of $278.4M (+53% Y/Y) beats by $4M. Shares +2.5% AH. (PR)

    Computer Sciences (CSC) declares $0.20/share quarterly dividend, in line with previous. Forward...

    Computer Sciences (CSC) declares $0.20/share quarterly dividend, in line with previous. Forward yield 2.71%. For shareholders of record Sep 05. Payable Oct 04. Ex-div date Sep 03. Shares -1.8% AH. (PR)

    Kinross Gold (NYSE:KGC) declares $0.08/share quarterly dividend, in line with previous. Forward yield 2.04%. For shareholders of record Sep 21. Payable Sep 28. Ex-div date Sep 17. Shares -3.1% AH. (PR)

  • RST

    More on Rosetta Stone's Q2: No explanation is given for the poor results. However, the company...

    More on Rosetta Stone's Q2: No explanation is given for the poor results. However, the company notes international consumer sales fell 33% Y/Y to $8.1M, worse than Q1's 14% drop, and U.S. consumer swung from a 52% Q1 increase to a 4% decline. Institutional sales fell 2%, nearly even with Q1. Rosetta is expanding its 2012 adjusted EBITDA guidance range to the downside, but is leaving its revenue guidance unchanged. The Street appears skeptical. RST -23.8% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 5:48 PM
  • TNGO

    Tangoe (OTC:TNGO): Q2 EPS of $0.10 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $36.3M (+39% Y/Y) beats by $1M....

    Tangoe (OTC:TNGO): Q2 EPS of $0.10 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $36.3M (+39% Y/Y) beats by $1M. Shares +1% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:37 PM
  • SGI

    Silicon Graphics (NASDAQ:SGI): FQ4 EPS of -$0.10 beats by $0.33. Revenue of $179M (-8.2% Y/Y)...

    Silicon Graphics (NASDAQ:SGI): FQ4 EPS of -$0.10 beats by $0.33. Revenue of $179M (-8.2% Y/Y) misses by $6M. Shares +7.6% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:30 PM
  • S

    Clearwire (CLWR +18.5%) closed with a huge gain, thanks to remarks in Dish Networks'...

    Clearwire (CLWR +18.5%) closed with a huge gain, thanks to remarks in Dish Networks' (NASDAQ:DISH) Q2 10-Q about the satellite TV provider owning "debt and equity investments of public companies with a fair value of $737 million .... concentrated in the debt securities of a single issuer." Wells Fargo and others think the issuer is Clearwire, which, like Dish, owns valuable 4G spectrum. If Dish's plans to build a 4G network are more than a bluff, Clearwire could be a useful partner. (Dish Q2)

     
     
     
     
    | 5:29 PM | 2 Comments

    Salix Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:SLXP): Q2 EPS of $0.79 beats by $0.25. Revenue of $181M (+36% Y/Y)...

    Salix Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:SLXP): Q2 EPS of $0.79 beats by $0.25. Revenue of $181M (+36% Y/Y) in-line. Shares +9.4% AH. (PR)

    The Providence Service (NASDAQ:PRSC): Q2 EPS of $0.11 may not be comparable to consensus of...

    The Providence Service (NASDAQ:PRSC): Q2 EPS of $0.11 may not be comparable to consensus of $0.17. Revenue of $278.9M (+18.5% Y/Y) beats by $4M. Shares -1.4% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:25 PM
  • ZNGA

    Zynga (NASDAQ:ZNGA) COO John Schappert has resigned from his position, as well as Zynga's board....

    Zynga (NASDAQ:ZNGA) COO John Schappert has resigned from his position, as well as Zynga's board. The resignation comes a week after reports CEO Mark Pincus had taken away Schappert's authority over Zynga's game development efforts, a move that wasn't well-received by investors. ZNGA -2% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:17 PM | 5 Comments
  • BHC

    Medicis Pharmaceutical (MRX): Q2 EPS of $0.52 beats by $0.06. Revenue of $197M (+3% Y/Y) beats...

  • KGC

    Kinross Gold (NYSE:KGC): Q2 EPS of $0.14 misses by $0.03. Revenue of $1.01B (+4.5% Y/Y) misses...

    Kinross Gold (NYSE:KGC): Q2 EPS of $0.14 misses by $0.03. Revenue of $1.01B (+4.5% Y/Y) misses by $30M. Due to the disposition of its 50% interest in Crixas, KGC now expects to produce 2.5M-2.6M gold equivalent oz. in 2012 from continuing operations vs. its previous forecast of 2.6M-2.8M. Shares -3.2% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:13 PM
  • NWSA

    More on News Corp (NASDAQ:NWSA): Q2 was mixed, coming in line on EPS estimates but missing on...

    More on News Corp (NASDAQ:NWSA): Q2 was mixed, coming in line on EPS estimates but missing on its top line. Total revenue declined Y/Y, hit by pre-tax impairment and restructuring charges primarily related to the company's publishing businesses, as well as $15M of other pre-tax losses. Shares -3.4% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:06 PM | 1 Comment
  • GHDX

    Genomic Health (NASDAQ:GHDX): Q2 EPS of $0.06 beats by $0.08. Revenue of $57.6M (+13.4% Y/Y)...

    Genomic Health (NASDAQ:GHDX): Q2 EPS of $0.06 beats by $0.08. Revenue of $57.6M (+13.4% Y/Y) misses by $1M. Shares -1.3% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:04 PM
  • MM

    More on Millennial Media's Q2: Q3 revenue guidance of $43.5M-$45M is in-line with a $43.8M...

    More on Millennial Media's Q2: Q3 revenue guidance of $43.5M-$45M is in-line with a $43.8M consensus. But full-year revenue guidance of $176M-$179M is above a $175.1M consensus. Monthly unique ad viewers rose by 50M Q/Q to 350M, and the number of app on Millennial's display ad network rose by 5K to 35K. MM +7% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:51 PM
  • MBI

    More on MBIA (NYSE:MBI): Adjusted book value/share of $31.23 vs. $32 in Q1. Net income of $581M...

    More on MBIA (NYSE:MBI): Adjusted book value/share of $31.23 vs. $32 in Q1. Net income of $581M ($2.98/share) was boosted by $1.2B pre-tax unrealized gains on credit derivatives. Taken out, loss was $152M vs. income of $161M a year ago. Heavy CMBS exposure resides with BofA, currently (according to MBIA) in default of its obligation to repurchase billions in mortgages. Trial begins in 2013. Shares +5.7% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:50 PM
  • DDS

    Dillard's (NYSE:DDS): Q2 EPS of $0.63 beats by $0.17. Revenue of $1.49B (+3.3% Y/Y) beats by...

    Dillard's (NYSE:DDS): Q2 EPS of $0.63 beats by $0.17. Revenue of $1.49B (+3.3% Y/Y) beats by $20M. Shares +4.8% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:48 PM

    Corrections of America (NYSE:CXW): Q2 EPS of $0.38 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $442.8M (+3% Y/Y)...

    Corrections of America (NYSE:CXW): Q2 EPS of $0.38 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $442.8M (+3% Y/Y) beats by $6M. Shares +3.1% AH. (PR)

  • WIFI

    Boingo Wireless (NASDAQ:WIFI): Q2 EPS of $0.04 misses by $0.01. Revenue of $24.3M (+6.1% Y/Y)...

    Boingo Wireless (NASDAQ:WIFI): Q2 EPS of $0.04 misses by $0.01. Revenue of $24.3M (+6.1% Y/Y) misses by $1.3M. Shares -10% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:35 PM
  • MDRX

    More on Allscripts (NASDAQ:MDRX): Q2 comes in mixed, with revenue in line but missing on bottom...

    More on Allscripts (NASDAQ:MDRX): Q2 comes in mixed, with revenue in line but missing on bottom line EPS estimates. Shares are higher in the post session however, as the company guides its fiscal year estimates higher. For 2012, it now expects revenue of $1.48B to $1.52B and an EPS of $0.77 to $0.83. The Street is at $1.49B in revenue and EPS of $0.74. Shares +8.8% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:33 PM
  • AMD

    AMD (AMD +9.5%) rallied in afternoon trading, apparently on M&A speculation. Evercore's...

    AMD (AMD +9.5%) rallied in afternoon trading, apparently on M&A speculation. Evercore's Patrick Wang says Qualcomm (NASDAQ:QCOM) and Samsung (OTC:SSNLF) have been mentioned as potential buyers. But would these companies, both of whom develop ARM-based processors, be that interested in an x86 processor developer that's heavily exposed to a weak PC market, and is perpetually at a resource disadvantage relative to Intel (NASDAQ:INTC)? 15.9% of AMD's float was shorted as of July 13.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:32 PM | 4 Comments
  • SGEN

    Seattle Genetics (NASDAQ:SGEN): Q2 EPS of -$0.15 in-line. Revenue of $48.8M (+272% Y/Y) misses...

    Seattle Genetics (NASDAQ:SGEN): Q2 EPS of -$0.15 in-line. Revenue of $48.8M (+272% Y/Y) misses by $1M. Shares -9.5% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:26 PM
  • SPWR

    SunPower (NASDAQ:SPWR) is now down 14.1% AH following its Q2 report. It looks as if the Street...

    SunPower (NASDAQ:SPWR) is now down 14.1% AH following its Q2 report. It looks as if the Street is skeptical about full-year guidance, and is focusing on the Q2 top-line miss and soft Q3 forecast. SunPower's gross margin rose 240 bps Q/Q to 15.1% thanks to a 10% drop in cost per watt, and played a big role in the EPS beat. However, it's expected to fall to the 10%-12% range in Q3. Other solar names could end up declining tomorrow in sympathy. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:24 PM
  • OLED

    Universal Display (NASDAQ:PANL): Q2 EPS of $0.23 misses by $0.02. Revenue of $30M (+166% Y/Y)...

    Universal Display (NASDAQ:PANL): Q2 EPS of $0.23 misses by $0.02. Revenue of $30M (+166% Y/Y) beats by $1M. Shares +8.2% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:23 PM
  • MNST

    Shares of Monster Beverage (NASDAQ:MNST) sink following an earnings report with "no teeth" that...

    Shares of Monster Beverage (NASDAQ:MNST) sink following an earnings report with "no teeth" that misses on the top and bottom lines. While revenue rose briskly on a year-over-year comparison, it wasn't enough to satisfy the thirst of investors looking for even more explosive growth. The company also saw gross profit margin as a percentage of sales slip 100 bps Y/Y to 51.8% during the period. MNST -10.5% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:22 PM | 9 Comments
  • SATCQ

    SatCon Technology (SATC): Q2 EPS of -$0.37 misses by $0.31. Revenue of $23.7M (-2% Y/Y) misses...

    SatCon Technology (SATC): Q2 EPS of -$0.37 misses by $0.31. Revenue of $23.7M (-2% Y/Y) misses by $3M. Shares +1.8% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:22 PM
  • MM

    Millennial Media (NYSE:MM): Q2 EPS of -$0.03 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $39.4M (+75.9% Y/Y)...

    Millennial Media (NYSE:MM): Q2 EPS of -$0.03 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $39.4M (+75.9% Y/Y) beats by $1.5M. Shares +7% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:17 PM
  • MNST

    Monster Beverage (NASDAQ:MNST): Q2 EPS of $0.59 misses by $0.02. Revenue of $593M (+28.7% Y/Y)...

    Monster Beverage (NASDAQ:MNST): Q2 EPS of $0.59 misses by $0.02. Revenue of $593M (+28.7% Y/Y) misses by $3M. Shares -19.3% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:10 PM | 3 Comments
  • NWSA

    News Corp (NASDAQ:NWSA): FQ4 EPS of $0.32 in-line. Revenue of $8.37B (-6.6% Y/Y) misses by...

    News Corp (NASDAQ:NWSA): FQ4 EPS of $0.32 in-line. Revenue of $8.37B (-6.6% Y/Y) misses by $360M. Shares -2% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:09 PM
  • ENPH

    Enphase Energy (ENPH -26.4%) shares suffer after reporting its net losses widened to $11.4M in...

    Enphase Energy (ENPH -26.4%) shares suffer after reporting its net losses widened to $11.4M in Q2, although margins improved on stronger demand from the North American market. The solar inverter maker also said its CFO decided to leave.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:59 PM
  • SKYW

    Airline operator SkyWest (SKYW +22%) soars after posting a much better than expected Q2 earnings...

    Airline operator SkyWest (SKYW +22%) soars after posting a much better than expected Q2 earnings report this morning. Total revenue rose 4.4% Y/Y, driven by increased incentive payments and better on-time and completion factor performance.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:48 PM
  • CAT

    Caterpillar (CAT +0.2%) says in its presentation at Jefferies Industrial and A&D conference...

    Caterpillar (CAT +0.2%) says in its presentation at Jefferies Industrial and A&D conference that it sees FY12 revenue coming in near the high-end of estimates, between $68B-$70B, versus the Street consensus of $68.82B. It also reaffirms its FY12 EPS view of $9.60. The Street has a consensus estimate of $9.61. (Presentation)

     
     
     
     
    | 3:41 PM | 2 Comments
  • IO

    Ion Geophysical (IO +11.6%) surges to big gains after Q2 earnings beat estimates and margins...

    Ion Geophysical (IO +11.6%) surges to big gains after Q2 earnings beat estimates and margins improved significantly, driven by its solutions segment which benefited from data processing revenue growth and improved sales from a more profitable mix of data libraries. IO says it is "positioned to achieve Y/Y improvement in both revenue and profitability in the back half of 2012."

     
     
     
     
    | 3:30 PM
  • CMG

    Shares of Chipotle (CMG -2.1%) trail off with McDonald's weak July sales numbers providing a...

    Shares of Chipotle (CMG -2.1%) trail off with McDonald's weak July sales numbers providing a potential warning shot that the QSR space could stay under pressure. But as opposed to its one-time parent, Chipotle is still a growth story with same-store sales totals for the last quarter disappointing by only rising by 8%. It's also still the darling of analysts, with a median average price target standing at a lofty $399.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:17 PM
  • SEM

    Select Medical Holdings (SEM +17.6%) spikes higher after Q2 results beat analyst estimates late...

    Select Medical Holdings (SEM +17.6%) spikes higher after Q2 results beat analyst estimates late yesterday. The company also guided full-year earnings higher, now seeing FY12 EPS coming in between $1.01 to $1.06 on revenue of $2.9B-$2.975B, versus consensus estimates of $0.94 per share on revenue of $2.94B.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:13 PM
  • RIO

    Despite falling iron ore prices that drove a 22% drop in H1 earnings, Rio Tinto (RIO +2.4%) is...

    Despite falling iron ore prices that drove a 22% drop in H1 earnings, Rio Tinto (RIO +2.4%) is sticking with plans for a $16.9B expansion of its Australia iron ore operations. The metal now contributes 80% of net profit, and as every 10% fall in its price causes Rio's earnings to fall by $1B, investors could remain nervous as long as there's so much iron in Rio's diet.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:12 PM
  • RL

    Shares of Polo Ralph Lauren (RL -0.8%) come roaring back on heavy volume after a weak opening....

    Shares of Polo Ralph Lauren (RL -0.8%) come roaring back on heavy volume after a weak opening. On an earnings CC (webcast), execs painted a strained earnings outlook for the luxury retailer, and the call curiously came and went without any further details about the amount of expenses the firm shifted out of FQ1 to the balance of the year.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:45 PM
  • AAL

    Pilots for American Airlines (AAMRQ.PK -1.2%) have overwhelmingly rejected the company's final...

    Pilots for American Airlines (AAMRQ.PK -1.2%) have overwhelmingly rejected the company's final contract offer, but its mechanics approved a contract by a razor-thin margin. Many pilots are hoping the company will be forced into a merger with US Airways (LCC +5.7%), and believe that ratifying the offer would have strengthened the position of management and made a merger less likely.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:40 PM
  • GPOR

    Gulfport Energy's (GPOR +16.9%) Q2 results missed Wall Street estimates, but investors are...

    Gulfport Energy's (GPOR +16.9%) Q2 results missed Wall Street estimates, but investors are excited by the company's first Utica Shale well, which Global Hunter calls a "veritable monster" that could lead to "enormous dividends" if its performance is readily repeatable. Stifel Nicolaus ups its price target on the shares to $26 from $25.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:38 PM
  • VHC

    Volatile VirnetX (VHC -5.9%) is heading lower. Yesterday, SA's Value Bulldog (formerly Special...

    Volatile VirnetX (VHC -5.9%) is heading lower. Yesterday, SA's Value Bulldog (formerly Special K) provided the second part of a bearish report on the IP holder (previous). Among the author's arguments: VirnetX efforts to have its 4G patents declared standards-essential remain in limbo; the company is unlikely to collect a 1% royalty on 4G phone sales, as some hope; and the company appears richly valued relative to fellow mobile patent holder InterDigital.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:28 PM | 4 Comments
  • KGC

    Kinross Gold (KGC +1.9%) shares and options are active, attributed to speculation the company...

    Kinross Gold (KGC +1.9%) shares and options are active, attributed to speculation the company has hired a financial advisor. A report last week suggested that a CEO swap had sparked rumors of a takeover bid.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:25 PM
  • URS

    URS (URS +6.4%) gains after its Q2 beat EPS and revenue estimates earlier this morning. Total...

    URS (URS +6.4%) gains after its Q2 beat EPS and revenue estimates earlier this morning. Total revenue rose 14% year, but net earnings fell 20% on charges related to its recent Flint Energy Services Ltd. acquisition. The company also raises its FY12 EPS outlook to $4.15 - $4.25, from prior estimates of $3.95 - $4.05, while revenues are expected to be $11B. Analysts are looking for an EPS of $4.10 on revenues of $10.71B.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:18 PM
  • PBR

    Brazil's energy minister says an increase in local fuel prices is necessary, so Petrobras (PBR...

    Brazil's energy minister says an increase in local fuel prices is necessary, so Petrobras (PBR +4.5%) shares are popping on the promise of more profitable gasoline sales. Brazil's government allowed PBR to raise wholesale prices of gasoline and diesel in June for the first time in six years, but analysts said it wasn't enough to reverse losses in distribution and refining.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:09 PM
  • AONEQ

    A123 Systems (AONE +8.7%) has given back the majority of its premarket gains, as investors...

    A123 Systems (AONE +8.7%) has given back the majority of its premarket gains, as investors examine the details of its financing deal with China's Wanxiang Group, which features a bridge loan, convertible notes, and warrants. Forbes' Tom Konrad estimates Wanxiang will be able to acquire an 80% stake in A123 at a price of $0.55/share, moderately above its current level of $0.51. (Q2 miss)

     
     
     
     
    | 2:05 PM | 3 Comments
  • IBM

    Kenexa (KNXA +14.8%) surges after its Q2 results and guidance indicate strong margin...

    Kenexa (KNXA +14.8%) surges after its Q2 results and guidance indicate strong margin improvement. While Q3 revenue guidance of $90M-$93.7M is largely below a $93.7M consensus, EPS guidance of $0.29-$0.32 is mostly above a $0.29 consensus. A similar story holds for full-year guidance. The Street seems willing to overlook the fact deferred revenue fell slightly Q/Q to $96.4M. Rival Cornerstone OnDemand (CSOD +2.4%) is also higher.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:33 PM
  • ALLT

    Allot (ALLT +8.4%) jumps after Oppenheimer defends the company, which sold off last week due to...

    Allot (ALLT +8.4%) jumps after Oppenheimer defends the company, which sold off last week due to the cautious commentary included with its Q2 beat. After meeting with management, Oppenheimer is positive on Allot's pipeline, and declares it to be filled with "mega carrier opportunities." Allot has fared better this year than many of its telecom equipment peers, which have been pressured by capex and European macro fears.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:11 PM
  • ELON

    Shares of Echelon (ELON -17%) take a hit after its Q2 guidance disappoints investors. The...

    Shares of Echelon (ELON -17%) take a hit after its Q2 guidance disappoints investors. The company is now calling for a sharp sequential Q/Q decline in revenue. Jefferies, Cantor and ThinkEquity all downgrade the stock on the back of the report.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:09 PM
  • NUAN

    Nuance (NUAN +6.5%) rallies after stating it has no plans to make a bid for clinical...

    Nuance (NUAN +6.5%) rallies after stating it has no plans to make a bid for clinical transcription rival M*Modal (MODL -1.6%), which is set to be purchased by JPMorgan's P-E arm for $14/share. The weak Q2 report delivered yesterday by M*Modal could be a reason why. M*Modal had previously disclosed it turned down a $17/share offer from a competitor widely believed to be Nuance, due to timing and antitrust worries.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:00 PM
  • AKS

    AK Steel (AKS +5.2%) shares continue on a roll this week, posting their third straight strong...

    AK Steel (AKS +5.2%) shares continue on a roll this week, posting their third straight strong gain after Monday's news that it will hike spot prices on flat-rolled steel products. Today, CRT Capital raised its rating on the stock to Buy from Fair Value with a $7 target price.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:53 PM
  • CBB

    Cincinnati Bell (CBB +10.4%) soars after its CyrusOne data center subsidiary files for a $300M...

    Cincinnati Bell (CBB +10.4%) soars after its CyrusOne data center subsidiary files for a $300M IPO under the symbol CONE. CyrusOne, whose filing comes at a time when valuations have surged for data center owners, produced revenue of $52.1M (+22% Y/Y) in Q1, and a net loss of $0.7M. Operating cash flow totaled $12.5M.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:49 PM
  • AAL

    US Airways (LCC +2.6%) says it's reached a tentative agreement with the Association of Flight...

    US Airways (LCC +2.6%) says it's reached a tentative agreement with the Association of Flight Attendants, which represents LCC's flight attendants. Details of the agreement are not yet available, but the tentative contract will cover the airline's 6,800 mainline flight attendants, who are based in it's three hub cities; Phoenix, Philadelphia and Charlotte, N.C., as well as Washington, D.C., a focus city.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:45 PM
  • CLH

    Clean Harbors (CLH -7.4%) takes a hit today after missing on its Q2 across the board. Total...

    Clean Harbors (CLH -7.4%) takes a hit today after missing on its Q2 across the board. Total revenue rose 17% Y/Y as the company focused more on liquids amid depressed natural-gas prices, but its energy business was hit by a seasonal slowdown due to the Spring break-up in Western Canada and extended wet weather conditions in the quarter. The company affirms its FY12 revenue estimates in the range of $2.2B to $2.25B.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:34 PM

    Shares of Primo Water (PRMW -25.9%) are getting clobbered today, despite posting a Q2 report that was largely in-line with estimates. Total revenue jumped 20% Y/Y, driven by higher sales of its water dispenser units. However, the company says it's seeing slower than anticipated growth in its flavorstation business, and lowers numbers for both Q3 and FY12. It also says its planning a strategic review that may include selling the flavorstation business altogether.

    Solar stocks outperform (TAN +1.4%) following MEMC's (WFR +18%) strong Q2 report. Revenue of $933.4M (+20% Y/Y and +78% Q/Q) blew past consensus by $184M, while non-GAAP EPS of $0.14 beat by $0.16. Also, MEMC is guiding for wafer revenue to grow 3%-8% Q/Q, which suggests a consensus for a 31% drop in total revenue will prove quite low. Between MEMC and First Solar, is there reason to think solar is finally bottoming? There's still a lot of bad news to go around. (PR)
